list.name: Changes
list.comment: added message before testing exception handling

task.summary: Default task

finished all methods in Factory except export to file
Tested factory methods
finished mode, median methods in stats library
wrote and tested factorial method
wrote and tested combinations and permutations methods, added zero factorial case to factorial method

wrote calculateVariance method
factorial method needs more testing. produces small and negative numbers

wrote and tested Intersection and Union methods
Union throws OOB exception in sort and keep unique elements method

fixed variance method and consolidated these steps in std deviation method
changed some values in tester for factorial tests in debugging

further tested and updated union method; no longer throwing out of bounds exceptions for index and values are correct
factorial method negative and incorrect values due to trailing zeroes in representation - try using built in biginteger methods?
successfully debugged and tested factorial method. completed and tested binomial and geometric distribution methods. updated javadoc.
successfully debugged and tested factorial method. completed and tested binomial and geometric distribution methods. updated javadoc.
started work on poisson distribution.
added minimal pseudocode for chebyshev's.
reorganized files for easier identification within project.
reorganized files for easier identification within project.
reorganized more files. started Extrav program version 0.01; Wrote short readme on goals of program and application.
Coded probability axioms 1 and 2; Coded Theorem of Total Probability; Added more pseudocode to Extravagance; Reorganized tester into neater sectioned comment blocks.
Coded Poisson Distribution and Poisson Lambda. Added needed comment blocks to tester for the rest of the intended methods.
debugged squareList method which fixed bugs with variance and standard deviation methods. laid out pseudocode for using class with generics. began work on conditional probability.

Stats Library: coded binomialMean and binomialVariance. separated variable initialization from calculation steps for various methods to make declarations understandable. Birthday Problem: Separated Birthday Problem notes into txt file. Added some javaDoc notes to Person class. Car Factory: separated variable initialization from calculation steps to make declarations understandable. programmed and tested exportCars method.

Stats Library: coded binomialMean and binomialVariance. separated variable initialization from calculation steps for various methods to make declarations understandable. Birthday Problem: Separated Birthday Problem notes into txt file. Added some javaDoc notes to Person class. Car Factory: separated variable initialization from calculation steps to make declarations understandable. programmed and tested exportCars method. added image file of factory tester output to package.

Stats Library: continued work on Conditional Probability. Programmed compliment method. Hand Evaluator: Listed the correct types of hands. Created Deck class to implement in the future. Monte Hall: Copied assignment instructions from textbook.

Birthday Problem: Changed documentation to reflect current functionality of program - a pair of people sharing a birthday. Extravagance: Updated doc to reflect use of hyper geometric distribution. Homework: Worked out first two sets and started on third. Created a class for each to test in. Stats Library: added comments for hyper geometric distribution. Library Tester: moved some variable declarations outside comment blocks for ease of use in testing sections.
Stats Library: coded hypergeometric distribution, negative binomial distribution, and Tchebysheff's theorem and their associated mean and standard deviation methods and helper methods.
Stats Library: Finished coding Tchebysheff's.

Hand Evaluator: updated data structures used for variable and object encapsulation. created comparator for card object. coded and tested make deck, shuffle deck, draw card, draw hand, sort hand. laid out pseudocode for hand evaluation method. began debugging shuffle deck method (duplicates card values).

Monty Hall: Coded most of program and ran initial tests. My initial output had the probabilities of the choices backwards, so I began debugging and somehow made it even worse. Will need more time to adjust conditional statements to correctly eliminate doors as they are chosen by the user and the "host". Screenshot included.

Birthday Problem: Following the examples from the book, finished the program. Added a random names file for reading in. Built main method and began testing. Unfortunately I made some huge error somewhere, and will continue debugging. Current results included in package.

Monty Hall: Changed strategy for choosing which goat door to open and how to choose it. Instead of comparing arrays, we will remove elements from an array of all the doors until we are left with our choices for the host.

Monty Hall: Coded strategy for changing doors. Testing revealed correct probability now displays for not changing the chosen door, but there are no wins for changing the door. Troubleshooting code revealed typecasting from int to char causing comparison issues. Debugging this section.
Monty Hall: Casting issue resolved. Current troubleshooting is focused on the removed doors. Need better implementation of code that simulates what door the host will open.

Monty Hall: Implemented new ways to check each door. Winner and user choice are still determined first. Then the host door is picked based on a comparison of the winner and user choice. If they are the same, a switch case handles the two choices the host will be able to randomly make. Otherwise, we make a string (as was originally implemented) and remove the two chosen door characters from it, leaving us with the one choice the host can make. Then, if the user wants to change their door, we just switch their choice to the number that is not the winner.

Monty Hall: Created helper method to find the remaining door. Debugging the following: Probability for changing the door and winning is now correct, but probability for not changing the door and winning is too high.
Monty Hall: Error in win count was wins variable not being reset between sets of 10000 runs. Fixed and tested successfully.
Monty Hall: Added results png
Removed dangling javadoc for nonexistent global variable
increased bound for random birthday assignment to 366

Reevaluated implementation of book example for calculations. Debugging led to the realization the signum of the final big integer value was zero due to division operations, which was returning zero as a result. changing division to double values with big integer methods led to the correct calculation.
Tested with multiple values. Probability increases rapidly after 20 people up until 50 people. Then afterward probability only climbs a few percent at a time until it peaks after 100.
export test file
created the CsvExportable interface to use in any class where exporting lists to excel is useful.
adjusted code in export method to match new interface implementation.
tested new implementation of export method as well as exception handling.
added more names to file for larger sample spaces.
example run of the birthday problem program.
added page numbers for book examples of calculation
small change to example under negative binomial distribution
deleted some comments from export method; added some pseudocode for future update to display method
deleted some comments from export method; deleted unused setters
added message before testing exception handling

Will need more time to adjust conditional statements to correctly eliminate doors as they are chosen by the user and the "host". Screenshot included.

Monty Hall: Implemented new ways to check each door. Winner and user choice are still determined first. Then the host door is picked based on a comparison of the winner and user choice. If they are the same, a switch case handles the two choices the host will be able to randomly make. Otherwise, we make a string (as was originally implemented) and remove the two chosen door characters from it, leaving us with the one choice the host can make. Then, if the user wants to change their door, we just switch their choice to the number that is not the winner.
